title: tips on jayce
body:
ive recently started playing jayce and just wondering if any jayce mains or people whove played him a bit s6 could tell me the best way to him build to play him top.

also whats the best way to iniate a 1v1 to get the best combo in ,cannon stance or hammer stance?

replies.body:
Start in cannon stance. Hit them with a Q (through your E gate), then W for three quick auto attacks. They'll either engage or run, but if you connect you should have chunked them down a fair bit.

If they engage, switch to hammer stance, hit them with From the Skies, get your W field up, couple of AAs and use Ignite if you got it (though I tend to take TP in top lane). You can follow that up with E but use it carefully, if you hit them away from you then you're basically gifting them a low health disengage and short changing yourself a kill.

In terms of build - standard attack damage marks/quints, armor seals - but I take mana regen glyphs (most take magic resist). Just find he's a bit mana hungry early.

Item-wise I prioritise Manamune, Essence Reaver & Frozen Heart. Manamune is first item, next two are situational, depending on lane opponent, whether you're ahead or behind, team composition, etc. Boots are situational too.

End game, any combination of Lord Dominik / Infinity Edge / Trinity Force / Bloodthirster. Again, swap one out for armor if your team needs the tankiness. 

I'm not a ranked Jayce player but he seems to be pretty underused on OCE which gives you the advantage of opponents not knowing how to play against him.

You've definitely got some great tips in there, but I'll add a couple of small points onto it for OP!

1. Your AttackSpeed Steroid from your Cannon Form's W remains even after changing forms. This is extremely useful for the fact that you can swiflty do 3 autos in melee form to regain your mana when trading. It can come as a huge surprise to many players as they may continue to trade assuming you won't have any mana to followup with.

2. Spam your ultimate to change forms when running around the map (such as to lane/roaming or running away from enemies.) The Speed boost aspect of changing forms comes in handy and is very underrated. Especially in combination with the Hypercharge W and (Q) To the Skies to gapclose onto them, apply a slow and get 3 autos off as opposed to trying to hit from max range in cannon form. 

3. Jayce scales amazingly with Attack Damage, as a lot of his damage can be output with quick animation cancelling combos for huge burst. Because of this, armor penetration is a MUST for your AD to stay relevant in the mid-late game, otherwise your Shock Blast + Gate combo will just be eaten up by the enemy tankline.
yeah ive vsed him once since i started playing and have seen him played like 3 or 4 times. seems to be a common theme with mana dependent champions.
A lot of people don't know this but AA in hammer stance gives you mana.
